div.div: νόστος (νέομαι): return, return home; νόστου γαίης Φαιήκων, a reaching the land of the Phaeacians (γαίης, obj. gen.), without the notion of ‘returning,’ except in so far as a man who had been swimming as long as Odysseus had to swim would feel as if he had got back somewhere when he touched dry land, Od. 5.344.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
